meanings.sent1: The tornado will obliterate the small town.
meanings.sent2: The bomb could obliterate the entire building.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally hit the delete button and managed to obliterate my entire essay!
meanings.sent4: The wildfire threatened to obliterate the forest, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The giant monster in the movie had the power to obliterate entire cities with a single stomp.

meanings.sent1: The flood could obliterate the crops in the field.
meanings.sent2: The virus could potentially obliterate the entire population if not contained.
meanings.sent3: I used a wet cloth to obliviate the stain on my shirt.
meanings.sent4: The superhero's laser beam eyes could obliterate any obstacle in his path.
meanings.sent5: The tsunami had the power to obliterate everything in its path, leaving nothing standing.

meanings.sent1: The time-traveler accidentally obliterated his own existence by changing the past.
meanings.sent2: The dictator aimed to obliterate any evidence of the rebellion.
meanings.sent3: The magician waved his wand and managed to obliterate the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent4: The alien weapon had the power to obliterate entire planets with a single shot.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious potion had the ability to obliterate memories from one's mind.
